Self-Organizing Teams (PMBOK & Agile Practice Guide)
Agile methodologies, as referenced in the PMBOK Guide – Seventh Edition and the Agile Practice Guide, emphasize that teams should be self-organizing rather than being assigned by a manager.
The Scrum Guide also states that teams should decide how they organize and approach their work.

Team Collaboration & Performance (PMBOK – Resource Management)
The PMBOK Guide’s Resource Management section highlights the importance of team engagement and motivation.
Allowing members to have a say in team selection can improve commitment and performance.

Periodic Adjustments for Optimization
Agile teams continuously inspect and adapt (a principle in Agile & Lean methodologies).
Allowing periodic team selection aligns with Agile’s emphasis on team flexibility and iterative improvement.
